trans-unit.source: Process vehicle sensor data with Apache Storm on HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Process vehicle sensor data with Apache Storm on HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to process vehicle sensor data from Event Hubs using Apache Storm on HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to process vehicle sensor data from Event Hubs using Apache Storm on HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Add model data from DocumentDB, and store output to storage.
trans-unit.target: Add model data from DocumentDB, and store output to storage.

trans-unit.source: Process vehicle sensor data from Azure Event Hubs using Apache Storm on HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Process vehicle sensor data from Azure Event Hubs using Apache Storm on HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Learn how to process vehicle sensor data from Azure Event Hubs using Apache Storm on HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to process vehicle sensor data from Azure Event Hubs using Apache Storm on HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: This example reads sensor data from Azure Event Hubs, enriches the data by referencing data stored in Azure DocumentDB, and finally store the data into Azure Storage using the Hadoop File System (HDFS).
trans-unit.target: This example reads sensor data from Azure Event Hubs, enriches the data by referencing data stored in Azure DocumentDB, and finally store the data into Azure Storage using the Hadoop File System (HDFS).

trans-unit.source: ![HDInsight and the Internet of Things (IoT) architecture diagram](./media/hdinsight-storm-iot-eventhub-documentdb/iot.png)
trans-unit.target: ![HDInsight and the Internet of Things (IoT) architecture diagram](./media/hdinsight-storm-iot-eventhub-documentdb/iot.png)

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Adding sensors to vehicles allows you to predict equipment problems based on historical data trends, as well as make improvements to future versions based on usage pattern analysis.
trans-unit.target: Adding sensors to vehicles allows you to predict equipment problems based on historical data trends, as well as make improvements to future versions based on usage pattern analysis.

trans-unit.source: While traditional MapReduce batch processing can be used for this analysis, you must be able to quickly and efficiently load the data from all vehicles into Hadoop before MapReduce processing can occur.
trans-unit.target: While traditional MapReduce batch processing can be used for this analysis, you must be able to quickly and efficiently load the data from all vehicles into Hadoop before MapReduce processing can occur.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, you may wish to do analysis for critical failure paths (engine temperature, brakes, etc.) in real time.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, you may wish to do analysis for critical failure paths (engine temperature, brakes, etc.) in real time.

trans-unit.source: Azure Event Hubs are built to handle the massive volume of data generated by sensors, and Apache Storm on HDInsight can be used to load and process the data before storing it into HDFS (backed by Azure Storage) for additional MapReduce processing.
trans-unit.target: Azure Event Hubs are built to handle the massive volume of data generated by sensors, and Apache Storm on HDInsight can be used to load and process the data before storing it into HDFS (backed by Azure Storage) for additional MapReduce processing.

trans-unit.source: Solution
trans-unit.target: Solution

trans-unit.source: Telemetry data for engine temperature, ambient temperature, and vehicle speed is recorded by sensors, then sent to Event Hubs along with the car's Vehicle Identification Number (VIN) and a time stamp.
trans-unit.target: Telemetry data for engine temperature, ambient temperature, and vehicle speed is recorded by sensors, then sent to Event Hubs along with the car's Vehicle Identification Number (VIN) and a time stamp.

trans-unit.source: From there, a Storm Topology running on an Apache Storm on HDInsight cluster reads the data, processes it, and stores it into HDFS.
trans-unit.target: From there, a Storm Topology running on an Apache Storm on HDInsight cluster reads the data, processes it, and stores it into HDFS.

trans-unit.source: During processing, the VIN is used to retrieve model information from Azure DocumentDB.
trans-unit.target: During processing, the VIN is used to retrieve model information from Azure DocumentDB.

trans-unit.source: This is added to the data stream before it is stored.
trans-unit.target: This is added to the data stream before it is stored.

trans-unit.source: The components used in the Storm Topology are:
trans-unit.target: The components used in the Storm Topology are:

trans-unit.source: **EventHubSpout** - reads data from Azure Event Hubs
trans-unit.target: **EventHubSpout** - reads data from Azure Event Hubs

trans-unit.source: **TypeConversionBolt** - converts the JSON string from Event Hubs into a tuple containing the individual data values for engine temperature, ambient temperature, speed, VIN, and timestamp
trans-unit.target: **TypeConversionBolt** - converts the JSON string from Event Hubs into a tuple containing the individual data values for engine temperature, ambient temperature, speed, VIN, and timestamp

trans-unit.source: **DataReferencBolt** - looks up the vehicle model from DocumentDB using the VIN
trans-unit.target: **DataReferencBolt** - looks up the vehicle model from DocumentDB using the VIN

trans-unit.source: **WasbStoreBolt** - stores the data to HDFS (Azure Storage)
trans-unit.target: **WasbStoreBolt** - stores the data to HDFS (Azure Storage)

trans-unit.source: The following is a diagram of this solution:
trans-unit.target: The following is a diagram of this solution:

trans-unit.source: ![storm topology](./media/hdinsight-storm-iot-eventhub-documentdb/iottopology.png)
trans-unit.target: ![storm topology](./media/hdinsight-storm-iot-eventhub-documentdb/iottopology.png)

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This is a simplified diagram, and each component in the solution may have multiple instances.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This is a simplified diagram, and each component in the solution may have multiple instances.

trans-unit.source: For example, the multiple instances of each component in the topology are distributed across the nodes in the Storm on HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: For example, the multiple instances of each component in the topology are distributed across the nodes in the Storm on HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Implementation
trans-unit.target: Implementation

trans-unit.source: A complete, automated solution for this scenario is available as part of the HDInsight-Storm-Examples repository on GitHub.
trans-unit.target: A complete, automated solution for this scenario is available as part of the HDInsight-Storm-Examples repository on GitHub.

trans-unit.source: To use this example, follow the steps in the [IoTExample README.MD](https://github.com/hdinsight/hdinsight-storm-examples/blob/master/IotExample/README.md).
trans-unit.target: To use this example, follow the steps in the [IoTExample README.MD](https://github.com/hdinsight/hdinsight-storm-examples/blob/master/IotExample/README.md).

trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.target: For more example Storm topologies, see [Example topologies for Storm on HDInsight](hdinsight-storm-example-topology.md).
